chargeHist.descr: Harboring/Aiding a Felon (A/B/C/D or unclassified felony/life)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Laice J. Firkus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be held open for 30 days, joint and several with Bridget Lee. If there is a claim, to be given to copies so to file any appopriate objections.

Pay costs and DNA Surcharge.   If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Write letter of apology to victim, M.H.
No contact with victim M.H., other than the letter of apology.
Comply with any other assesmsent or counseling as recommended by the agent, may include AODA assessment and comply.

timeConds.notes: Perform 35 Hours of Community Service, preferrably with Portage County Parks Department.

ADDRESS INFO for Laice J. Firkus
Current: 6054 Oak Drive, Amherst, WI 54406 United States  (Effective: 04-14-2016)
Prior: 3017 Stanley Street #4, Stevens Point, WI 54481
Zero restitution.

Defendant Laice J. Firkus in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-116 and 15CM-225.

2:04 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Constable states appearances.

Address is verified.

There is a plea agreement.
Defendant will plead to Count 1 in 15CF-116 and plead to Count 1 in 15CM-225.
State addresses the plea agreement, no restitution has been requested but State requests the Court to hold open for 30 days if a request is received by the victim.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.

Atty Barkley concurs with one small detail.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-116: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CM-225: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Barkley for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-116: Obstructing an Officer
15CM-225: Receiving Stolen Property

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Barkley makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court believes the plea agreement is fair and appropriate.

BY THE COURT:
15CF-116:
Jail sentence of 90 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Probation for a period of 12 Months
Conditions:
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Restitution to be held open for 30 days, joint and several with Bridget Lee. If there is a claim, to be given to copies so to file any appopriate objections
Perform 35 Hours of Community Service, preferrably with Portage County Parks Department
Maintain full time employment
Write letter of apology to victim, M.H.
No contact with victim M.H., othert han the letter of apology
Comply with any other assesmsent or counseling as recommended by the agent, may include AODA assessment and comply

15CM-225:
Jail sentence of 90 Days, Imposed and Stayed, Concurrent to 15CF-116
Probation for a period of 12 Months, Concurrent to 15CF-116
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 15CF-116
Pay costs

Defendant Laice J. Firkus DOES NOT appear in court with attorney Jerod Barkley.  Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:05 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.
Court questions Attorney Barkley as to the whereabouts of his client.

Defendant has failed to appear.

Warrant for arrest.
for Attorney to Appear and Act

Defendant Laice J. Firkus in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:30 pm. Atty Cousins calls case.
Atty Cousins indicates there is an agreement with the defendant and that defendant wishes to proceed without an attorney.

Court indicates to Defendant that she has the right to an attorney.
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.

Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Court accepts oral waiver.
Bond Continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
